results.brief_description: Penny, aged about 18, is partially blind and has been attending the Lethbridge Rehabilitation Centre where Ann, her occupational therapist, works on a programme of activities for daily living.

results.title: Penitentiary
results.creator_credit: Ronald Weyman, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
A report on life and conditions in one of Canada’s penal institutions, illustrating current trends in the treatment of criminals. Defiant and contemptuous of society, a young first offender is brought to a federal penitentiary. The film shows the descipline, the confinement and the rigid routines which are part of a prisoner’s expiation for crime. It also deals with the challenge, now recognized by penitentiary authorities - either to change the prisoner into a law-abiding citizen or to have them come back a repeater - and with the new psychological approach which endeavours to determine the basic causes of a person’s wrong-doing.

results.title: Penicillin: the magic bullet
results.creator_credit: Arcimedia, Claire Jager and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: In 1945 the Nobel Prize for medicine was awarded to three men - Alexander Fleming, Ernst Chain, and the Australian, Howard Florey - as the inventors of penicillin, the “magic bullet” of medicine. This doumentary tells the true story behind the discovery of penicillin, the wonder drug of the twentieth century, which would change the face of modern civilisation by providing a cure for medical scourges such as pneumonia, meningitis, rheumatic fever, septicaemia and venereal diseases. Using dramatic re-enactments, “Penicillin : the magic bullet” charts the work of the Howard Florey’s team (including that of the overlooked Norman Heatley) as they struggled towards this medical breakthrough. Narrated by Martin Jacobs.

Using dramatic re-enactments, “Penicillin : the magic bullet” charts the work of the Howard Florey’s team (including that of the overlooked Norman Heatley) as they struggled towards this medical breakthrough. Narrated by Martin Jacobs.

results.title: Penguins off the page
results.brief_description: A biology teacher struggles to make his students pay attention to his lesson on different species of penguins. Little does he know that the very penguins he is discussing have come to life on his desktop, providing an amusing performance that brings his words to life. A plasticine animation in a live action classroom.

results.title: Penguins off the page
results.creator_credit: Jon Rowdon and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
A plasticine animation in a live action classroom. Today’s biology lesson is about the different types of penguins. The peculiar magic of wildlife comes to the classroom as penguins colonise his desk to bring each of the species of penguins to life. As the lesson progresses the class watches each species appear and play amongst the mess on the teacher’s desk.

results.title: Penguin island: Australia's little penguins
results.creator_credit: BandG Communications, Gordon Badham and Patrick Gillespie
results.brief_description: Hosted by Peter Hoskings, this is a tourist orientated film that never the less provides a wealth of facts and figures about the fairy penguins, and background information about Phillip Island. Excellent cinematography reveals much about the scenary and wild life of the island including koalas, kangaroos and wallabies, wombats, seals, wild flowers and birds.

results.title: Penguin Island
results.brief_description: A film record of the various types of animal life found by the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition (1948-1950) during their stay on Macquarie Island. Shows many species of seals, penguins and birds, including the Great Wandering Albatross. Recordings of sounds made by penguins are used in the introduction to the film.

results.title: Penetrator for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette & cover in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description:
Penetrator is a side scrolling shooter for one or two players for the Commodore 64. The player flies a fighter across the screen from left to right, dodging terrain and enemy shots and shooting enemy structures. Players can accelerate and brake their fighter but prolonged braking can stall it. Enemies become more accurate the longer the player is exposed to the radar and the danger level is shown on the player’s console. The game can also be customised for landscape and the number and positions of enemy missile and radar bases.

Original game developed by Beam Software for Commodore 64, published in 1982 by Melbourne House

results.title: Pending
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Paola Garofali and Anna Tow
results.brief_description: In this fantasy animation, Jasmine flees her war-torn country for the safety of the towering City of Anchors. But between her traumatic past and her hopes for a new life, Jasmine must first face a heartless Immigration Department bureaucrat and persuade him to let her stay. Original Format 35 mm/colour.
